history.content:
You will definitely be busy. CS 162 is a complete project based course and will take a bunch of your time, and CS 70 has weekly homework sets that also take a good portion of your time (especially if you’re not good with probability). CS 186 is also extremely busy when homeworks come around, and while it is an online class you do not want to fall behind the lecture videos. 

You will probably feel like you don’t have any free time, and if that’s ok with you then go for it. Also consider that fall is recruiting season so you will probably be really in a time crunch and might not be able to prepare for interviews...

children.subject: Thanks for the advice! The three techs I took were 61b (with Hug), 61c (with Weaver) and 16b (with Sahai).
16b definitely isn't medium hard--I'd say it's an easy tech. 61bc also aren't hard, although 61b is a bit of a weeder as a LSCS prereq. And as mentioned above, 162 has a very heavy workload.

So 61b/61c/16b is definitely a tough schedule (especially for a freshman), so you might be able to handle it but just for comparison sake...

- 70 is conceptually more difficult than 16b and more time consuming (how much more time consuming depends on your math maturity).

- 162 is comparable to 61c in terms of content, but significantly more time consuming. Also you need a solid group to take this class, I don't recommend taking it without a group.

- 186 is similar workload to 61b. If you took 61b without much programming experience going into it, 61b might actually have been more difficult and time consuming.

I took 162 and 70 together with another tech last semester and managed to do ok in all of them for my standards (B+ or higher) without being unreasonably busy. I personally would not consider math a strength of mine and I would estimate that Sahai's 16B would be twice as much work for me as 70 (no homework option, not sure if that is a reasonable comparison). The time commitment for 162 really depends on your group. I know some teams that had an all-star groupmember so they would be required to put an average amount of time into the projects and I know some with slacker group members so they would be super busy. I'd recommend reaching out ASAP to good groupmembers you know to make a group.

What were your medium hard techs? 162 is arguably the highest workload cs class, 70 can be very difficult if you don't have a strong math background (it's harder than 16a/16b) and 186 is a medium workload class that takes a lot of time when homeworks are due. I personally would not take this schedule. I'd recommend either dropping 186 or 70 (probably 186 to get your lower divs out of the way) or if you really want to take 3 techs subbing out 162 for something more manageable (maybe 161?).

history.content:
I'm thinking of taking CS 70, CS 162 and CS 186 next semester. Does the courseload seem reasonable? Would I also be able to add a breadth humanities class (low time commitment) as well?

For reference, this past semester I took 3 medium-hard techs and a breadth last semester got all As. Any suggestions would be very helpful!
history.subject: How doable is this schedule?
